intro: Stixis yingjiangensis, commonly known as the Yungjiang stixis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study.
